roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses
Class Element

java.lang.Object
  roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Element
Direct Known Subclasses:
Item, Robot, Wall
public abstract class Element
extends Terminatable

Version:
24 may 2012
Author:
Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven
Invariants:
  • Each element must have either no position at all or exactly one valid position. It is possible to have a position without a board. But when an element has a board, its position must also be a valid position on that board.
        (this.getBoard() == null && Position.isValidPosition(this.getPosition()))
         || (this.getBoard() != null && this.getBoard().isValidPositionOnBoard(this.getPosition()))
  • Each element must have either no board at all or exactly one valid board. If an element has a board it must have a valid position as well.
        this.getBoard() == null
         || (!this.getBoard().isTerminated() && this.getBoard().isValidPositionOnBoard(this.getPosition()))
  • A terminated element cannot have a board or a position
        ! this.isTerminated()
         || (this.isTerminated() && this.getBoard() == null && this.getPosition() == null)

    Constructor Detail

    Element

    public Element(Position position,
               Board board)
    Initialize this new element with the given position and board if these are valid.

    Parameters:
    position - The position for this new element.
    board - The board on which this new element will be placed.
    Effects:
  • The new position of this new element is equal to the given element.
        this.setPosition(position)
  • The new board of this new element is equal to the given element.
        this.setBoard(board)

    canHavePosition

    public boolean canHavePosition(Position position)
    Checks whether the given position is a valid position for this element.

    Parameters:

    Returns:
    ...
        if(this.getBoard() == null) then result == Position.isValidPosition(position)
    Returns:

        if(this.getBoard() != null) then result == this.getBoard().isValidPositionOnBoard(position)

    canSharePositionWith

    public abstract boolean canSharePositionWith(Element other)
    Checks whether this element can share a position with another element.

    Parameters:
    other - The element where to this element may be in conflict.
    Returns:
    False if both this element is a robot and the other element is a robot.
        if((this instanceof Robot) && (other instanceof Robot)) then result == false
    Returns:
    False if either this element is a wall or the other element is a wall (or both).
        if((! (this instanceof Wall) || ! (other instanceof Wall)) the result == false

    takeHit

    public abstract void takeHit()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered. Which properties and to what extend, depends on the elements.

    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this element is terminated.
        this.isTerminated()
